text: A form application for mainly schools/colleges related applications such as conducting tests, surveys etc.
With this blog i will let you know each and every thing about the project 'Dock Forms' .

list: A whole new functionality of rooms (Basically creating a group of accounts) and on connecting rooms to your forms you can restrict the form to only limited people.
Edit form after it is created.
Home screen with all previously created forms and rooms.
Dedicated page for responses in a html table format.
Rooms editor and connect rooms to Forms dedicated pages.
Verification of OTP on mail using smtplib.
SQL Database as well as self created JSON based database
4 types of questions (mcq (with ans), mcq(survey type), range type, text type)

text: Beginning with the login page, this page has the login and signup options. When you sign up using a new email-id you get a mail with the OTP which needs to be verified and only then your account is created.
This is where you can create your own form. One can choose between three types of questions.

The multiple choice question provides you the freedom to have any number of options you want. Also You have a toggle for selecting whether the question has a correct answer or its a survey based question.
The text answer question provides a text-box for the respondent to answer.

Range type qustions provide a box where the respondent can enter numeric values, this type of question is useful when there are mathematical questions and the answers range between some values due to complex calculations.
A very simple page to create and add people to your room, just enter the user-id to add the user, you can also delete or add new users anytime later.
This is the page where all your previously created forms and rooms are displayed, you can create a new room/form from here or edit your previously created rooms/forms.
You can connect rooms from the rooms tab of each form. (You can connect multiple rooms to a form).
On the navbar there is a tab 'Give Response' where you just have to enter the id and then you are redirected to a new window where you have to respond to the form.
This is where all the responses to your form are stored. You can view, sort or delete them.
That is all for the walkthrough.
